description:
iLUKA, part of the CSM Sports & Entertainment group, is a specialised agency, developing and delivering coordinated strategic activations for sponsors and other stakeholders at global events. We are experts in executing cutting edge event hospitality experiences born from intelligent strategic direction. Our heritage is big events for big companies looking for strategic and measured solutions which focus on creating unforgettable experiences for stakeholders integral to sponsors success.

Our experience working with Sponsors, Organising Committees, International Sporting Federations, Governing Bodies and City stakeholders enables us to develop our clients sponsorship story to ensure that activations maximise the communication of their messages as well as guide global teams and their local markets through the unique complexities of delivering effectively at global events.


For the global sporting event based in Sochi in 2014 we have a number of vacancies for experienced Merchandise Managers, the right candidate will be Bilingual in Russian/English. The role is a fixed term contract starting December 2013 ending in March 2014, the role will be Accomodated.


DUE TO THE NUMBER OF APPLICATIONS WE RECEIVE, ONLY SUCESSFUL APPLICANTS WILL HEAR FROM US WITHIN 3 WEEKS.


Job Role:

The Event Merchandise Manager is responsible for delivery of the assigned sponsor merchandise programme. This position requires organisation, attention to detail and maintaining positive client relationships.

  • Apply effective client service and relationship management techniques to all clients
  • Manage project timeline with Venue Manager, ensuring on time delivery per wave
  • Manage goods-in, receipt of merchandise in venue
  • Manage quality control checks onsite, inventory reconciliation
  • Report inventory discrepancies to Warehouse Manager, Programme Manager and / or Account Director as necessary
  • Onsite  management of iLUKA premiums distribution
  • Effectively manage changes to programme and advise team of programme impact
  • Maintain open, current and effective communications with both the CST (Client Service Team) and Operations to ensure they are kept informed of project developments, updates, successes and issues at all times
  • Provide support to client during on site operations
  • Provide end of programme reports on team members and recommendations for future projects
  • Adhere to professional confidentiality standards, company policies, procedures and practices, maintaining the highest level of integrity regarding client management, and confidential information at all times
  • Track shipment from warehouse to venue and ensure on time delivery
  • Merchandise and execute assortment plans
  • Keep accurate daily inventory and manage overage amounts per wave
  • Participate in final budget reconciliation, reviewing for accuracy and compliance

Skills & Experience:

  • Project management experience
  • Fluent Russian/English
  • Merchandise experience
  • Strong IT skills
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Attention to detail
name: Merchandise Manager - Sporting Event
